intro: Thalysia mays, commonly known as the may apple, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive umbrella-shaped cluster of leaves. The plant produces a single greenish-white flower that develops into a fleshy, orange-colored fruit. Thalysia mays is known for its toxic sap and berries, which contain toxic compounds. It thrives in shaded, moist woodland environments and is often found in rich, loamy soil.
